Gujarat has a unique profile. The land is most fertile there is ocean coastline from Kutch in the West to Daman in South, a range of low lying hills from Aravali in the East to the Western hills with lush green forests, rivers flowing throughout the state. The rivers , farms , villages , towns, cities, markets and industries, temples and complexes add to its physical prosperity of the state of Gujarat .The state has plenty of historic monuments, religious places, along with industrial complexes and educational institutions . 
I Many legends, tales and stories of bravery and generosity have originated in the state of Gujarat. The culture and approach of the people of Gujarat is evident at the coast of Dandi in South Gujarat where Gandhiji accomplished the salt satyagarh, at the temple of Somnath on the coast of Saurashtra where the echoes of eternal tranquility is heard, religion and history are the way of life at Girnar or Pavgadh , booming business in the markets of Ahmedabad and Surat, folk-life rules the by lanes of Bhuj and Jamnagar, water flows in Narmada and Mahi and greenery plays with the wind in forest of Gir and Dang. 
The journey through the width and breadth of Gujarat is not merely a physical tour of the land; it is an introduction with its people who are probably the best in India. A treat, which gives an opportunity to know the Gujaratis in real sense. 
The state of Gujarat unfolds its wonder in abundance. With the biggest stretch of coastline in the country, the state of Gujarat has got countless beach pockets where the beach lovers can have a great time. For wildlife enthusiasts, the state offers a fascinating variety of wildlife in Sasan Gir sanctuary and other parks. For the devout pilgrims, Gujarat offers pilgrimage spots and temples at Palitana, Somnath, Dwarka and many more. Monuments and heritage structures of Ahmadabad are living example of one of the finest architectural works. Gujaratâ€™s rich tradition of handicraft and textiles has their unique styles developed over hundreds of years. 
The festivals and fairs are a time of rejoicement when the people shed their inhibitions and join unitedly in the festive moods. The festivities are mostly held in rural areas where the art, music and dances are displayed with all the originality and colours.
